result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher M Olivero was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
*AS To Both counts:
Court finds the domestic abuse surcharge is applicable.  Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 11/27/17.  Submit a DNA sample; pay the surcharge.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Concurrent with: With any other sentence with credit for 173 days time served.
*Court advised the defendant that due to this domestic abuse conviction, he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Concurrent with: With any other sentence with credit for 173 days time served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher M Olivero

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christopher M Olivero in court with attorney Crystal L. Saltzwadel.  Defendant Christopher M Olivero in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent with any other sentence with credit for 173 days time served.  
.
AS TO COUNT 2:  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent with any other sentence with credit for 173 days time served.  
.
Court finds the domestic abuse surcharge is applicable.  Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 11/27/17.  Submit a DNA sample; pay the surcharge.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Court advised the defendant that due to this domestic abuse conviction, he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit sheet.
Statements made by Ebony H.  Court denied the request to modify the no contact order.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2 AS AMENDED:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.

Defendant Christopher M Olivero in court with attorney Crystal L. Saltzwadel.  Defendant Christopher M Olivero in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered penalty enhancers, Repeater, dismissed.

Attorney Torrie R. Williams in court, defendant Christopher M Olivero not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial in Branch 40.  Due to defense counsel schedule, the 9/08/15 jury trial is rescheduled.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Jury trial scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Torrie R. Williams in court, defendant Christopher M Olivero not in court, in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Status Conference held off the record.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Torrie R. Williams in court, defendant Christopher M Olivero not in court, in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for pretrial conference.  Counsel would like to speak with the defendant before any dates are set.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact/No Firearms Order.  Defendant to have no contact with EBONY H.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Christopher M Olivero in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Defendant Christopher M Olivero in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
